conclusion: Analyze the graph of the square of velocities versus displacement to determine which car has greater acceleration.
The graph shows v^2 on the y-axis and x on the x-axis.
Equation of motion for uniformly accelerated linear motion: v^2 = u^2 + 2ax.
Both cars start from the same position and move in the same direction with the same initial velocity.
The graph represents the equation v^2 = u^2 + 2ax, and the slope represents 2a.
For Car A, the slope of the line is steeper compared to Car B.
For Car B, the slope of the line is less steep compared to Car A.
A steeper slope indicates a higher value of 2a, so Car A has a greater acceleration than Car B.
Since 2a_A > 2a_B, it follows that a_A > a_B.
